metadata.title: CVE-2017-7797 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Response header name interning does not have same-origin protections andthese headers are stored in a global registry. This allows stored headernames to be available cross-origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox <55.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
